Python

How Many Word Senses?

I wrote a library (using the term loosely) to implement my unsupervised method to identify the number of word senses using contextualized representations.

This workflow includes, from start to finish: SQL databases queried through Python. Flexible options for selecting contexts containing a target word and extracting the contextualized representations from BERT / ELMo / (non-contextualized) fastText. Dimensionality reduction and cross-validated clustering using sklearn and other goodies. Evaluation against ground truth data (WordNet). Batch scripting to run a gridsearch pipeline for 1000s of words. Plus tools for visualizing manually annotated data (see the Medium post for some fun graphs).

  • Code, including demo Jupyter Notebooks, is up on GitHub.

  • Read the write-up “Can we identify word senses from deep contextualized word embeddings without supervision?” on Medium.

• • •

R packages

stylest: Estimating speaker style distinctiveness in R

I’m the maintainer of stylest, created with Patrick O. Perry and Arthur Spirling. It’s written in R and built on top of corpus.

  • We’re on CRAN! Install using install.packages("stylest").

  • Read the vignette.

  • Read all about it! The paper is forthcoming in Political Analysis.

leaflet.providers: map provider metadata for leaflet

I wrote leaflet.providers while interning at RStudio on the Shiny team.

  • Install from CRAN using install.packages("leaflet.providers").

  • Check out the documentation.

corpus: fast text processing

I’m the maintainer for corpus, written by my colleague Patrick O. Perry.

  • Install from CRAN using install.packages("corpus").

zipR: Pythonic zip(), aka a better cbind() for R

I am the creator and maintainer of zipR, which implements Python-style zip().

  • Install from CRAN using install.packages("zipR").

  • View a demo.

• • •

Old stuff

Twitter network models (on hiatus since 2017)

I wrote some tools to scrape information about a Twitter user’s followers and those followers’ followers, in order to model networks between social media users.

  • See the Python repo here, and the R repo here.

  • I’m developing another custom R library for scraping and visualizing n-degree networks.
